speaker: Chorus
text_entry: SCENE I. London. An ante-chamber in the KING'S palace.

speaker: Chorus
text_entry: Enter the ARCHBISHOP OF CANTERBURY, and the BISHOP OF ELY

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: My lord, I'll tell you; that self bill is urged,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Which in the eleventh year of the last king's reign

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Was like, and had indeed against us pass'd,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: But that the scambling and unquiet time

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Did push it out of farther question.

speaker: ELY
text_entry: But how, my lord, shall we resist it now?

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: It must be thought on. If it pass against us,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: We lose the better half of our possession:

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: For all the temporal lands which men devout

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: By testament have given to the church

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Would they strip from us; being valued thus:

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: As much as would maintain, to the king's honour,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Full fifteen earls and fifteen hundred knights,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Six thousand and two hundred good esquires;

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: And, to relief of lazars and weak age,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Of indigent faint souls past corporal toil.

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: A hundred almshouses right well supplied;

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: And to the coffers of the king beside,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: A thousand pounds by the year: thus runs the bill.

speaker: ELY
text_entry: This would drink deep.

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: 'Twould drink the cup and all.

speaker: ELY
text_entry: But what prevention?

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: The king is full of grace and fair regard.

speaker: ELY
text_entry: And a true lover of the holy church.

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: The courses of his youth promised it not.

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: The breath no sooner left his father's body,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: But that his wildness, mortified in him,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Seem'd to die too; yea, at that very moment

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Consideration, like an angel, came

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: And whipp'd the offending Adam out of him,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Leaving his body as a paradise,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: To envelop and contain celestial spirits.

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Never was such a sudden scholar made;

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Never came reformation in a flood,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: With such a heady currance, scouring faults

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Nor never Hydra-headed wilfulness

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: So soon did lose his seat and all at once

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: As in this king.

speaker: ELY
text_entry: We are blessed in the change.

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Hear him but reason in divinity,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: And all-admiring with an inward wish

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: You would desire the king were made a prelate:

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Hear him debate of commonwealth affairs,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: You would say it hath been all in all his study:

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: List his discourse of war, and you shall hear

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: A fearful battle render'd you in music:

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Turn him to any cause of policy,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: The Gordian knot of it he will unloose,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Familiar as his garter: that, when he speaks,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: The air, a charter'd libertine, is still,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: And the mute wonder lurketh in men's ears,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: To steal his sweet and honey'd sentences;

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: So that the art and practic part of life

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Must be the mistress to this theoric:

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Which is a wonder how his grace should glean it,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Since his addiction was to courses vain,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: His companies unletter'd, rude and shallow,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: His hours fill'd up with riots, banquets, sports,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: And never noted in him any study,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Any retirement, any sequestration

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: From open haunts and popularity.

speaker: ELY
text_entry: The strawberry grows underneath the nettle

speaker: ELY
text_entry: And wholesome berries thrive and ripen best

speaker: ELY
text_entry: Neighbour'd by fruit of baser quality:

speaker: ELY
text_entry: And so the prince obscured his contemplation

speaker: ELY
text_entry: Under the veil of wildness; which, no doubt,

speaker: ELY
text_entry: Grew like the summer grass, fastest by night,

speaker: ELY
text_entry: Unseen, yet crescive in his faculty.

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: It must be so; for miracles are ceased;

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: And therefore we must needs admit the means

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: How things are perfected.

speaker: ELY
text_entry: But, my good lord,

speaker: ELY
text_entry: How now for mitigation of this bill

speaker: ELY
text_entry: Urged by the commons? Doth his majesty

speaker: ELY
text_entry: Incline to it, or no?

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: He seems indifferent,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Or rather swaying more upon our part

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Than cherishing the exhibiters against us;

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: For I have made an offer to his majesty,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Upon our spiritual convocation

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: And in regard of causes now in hand,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Which I have open'd to his grace at large,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: As touching France, to give a greater sum

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Than ever at one time the clergy yet

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Did to his predecessors part withal.

speaker: ELY
text_entry: How did this offer seem received, my lord?

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: With good acceptance of his majesty;

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Save that there was not time enough to hear,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: As I perceived his grace would fain have done,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: The severals and unhidden passages

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Of his true titles to some certain dukedoms

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: And generally to the crown and seat of France

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Derived from Edward, his great-grandfather.

speaker: ELY
text_entry: What was the impediment that broke this off?

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: The French ambassador upon that instant

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Craved audience; and the hour, I think, is come

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: To give him hearing: is it four o'clock?

speaker: ELY
text_entry: It is.

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Then go we in, to know his embassy;

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Which I could with a ready guess declare,

speaker: CANTERBURY
text_entry: Before the Frenchman speak a word of it.

speaker: ELY
text_entry: I'll wait upon you, and I long to hear it.

speaker: ELY
text_entry: Exeunt
